required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of tDCS in M1 and DLPFC on Pain Processing in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation on Primary Cortex and Prefrontal Dorsolateral Cortex in Pain Processing on Healthy Volunteers: A Triple Blind Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a direct current applied transcranial over two cortical areas on healthy volunteers' pain processing.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three groups cross over study with two intervention groups and one sham group.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Pain pressure threshold change after a painful ischemic stimulus
Change in pain perceived between the first and tenth painful pressure stimulus

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of pressure applied until the perception of pain
Measurement of maximal painful pressure tolerate using a pressure algometer
Measurement of range of motion achieved until the perception of tension

secondary_outcome.measure: Cold hyperalgesia with a cold pack
secondary_outcome.description: Pain rated in a visual analogue scale after 10 seconds of a cold stimulus
Maximal pressure achieved in a isometric gripping task

arm_group.description: A 20 minutes 1mA direct current stimulation over left M1.
A 20 minutes 1mA direct current stimulation over left M1 and 1mA direct current stimulation over left DLPFC.
A 20 minutes sham stimulation where the device only is working first 30s and last 30s of the intervention and have a 10 seconds fade out in intensity at each ramp.

intervention.description: Direct current application over the scalp to stimulate and change the excitability of the cortical areas underneath the electrodes (in this case left primary motor cortex and left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 40 years
- Comprehension of the study tasks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of pain in the previous 6 months
- Altered sensitivity in the tested regions
- Intolerance to electrotherapy
- Presence of pacemakers or any other implanted device
- Ulcers or scars in the skin at the location of the electrodes
- Treatment with direct current stimulation within one week
- Pregnancy
- Frequent headaches
- Epilepsy
- History of neuromuscular disease
- Previous clinical history of cervical surgery
- Injuries or surgery affecting the upper limb
- diabetes mellitus
- Cardiovascular diseases
- Oncological diseases
- Consumption of analgesic drugs 7 days before the study
